title: Unstable fingerprints at 'predicates_of(...)' error

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Hi there! I was practicing this [CodeWars kata](https://www.codewars.com/kata/54bf1c2cd5b56cc47f0007a1/train/rust) and stumbled with the following compiler error: ### Code As I was in the middle of the solution, this code's logic does not what it is intended to. ```Rust fn counting_duplicates(text: &str) -> u32 { let mut occurrence = String::new(); let mut count: u32 = 0; for letter in text.chars() { if text.contains(letter) || occurrence.contains(letter) { occurrence.push(letter); } else { count += 1; } } count } fn main() { // let mut test = String::from("Hello, world!"); // println!("{}", &test.rev().next()); } #[cfg(test)] mod tests { use super::*; #[test] fn test_abcde() { assert_eq!(counting_duplicates("abcde"), 0); } #[test] fn test_abcdea() { assert_eq!(counting_duplicates("abcdea"), 1); } #[test] fn test_indivisibility() { assert_eq!(counting_duplicates("indivisibility"), 1); } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ```bash rustc 1.53.0-nightly (07e0e2ec2 2021-03-24) binary: rustc commit-hash: 07e0e2ec268c140e607e1ac7f49f145612d0f597 commit-date: 2021-03-24 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.53.0-nightly LLVM version: 12.0.0 ``` Don't know if it is relevant, but I have updated rustup. But the problem is the same. Here is the update log: ```bash $ rustup self update info: checking for self-updates info: downloading self-update rustup updated - 1.24.1 (from 1.23.1) ``` ### Error output ```bash $ cargo test Compiling counting_duplicates v0.1.0 (/home/rafael/Documents/Repos/CodeArchive/CodeWars/counting_duplicates) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'found unstable fingerprints for predicates_of(core[3998]::iter::traits::collect::IntoIterator): GenericPredicates { parent: None, predicates: [(Binder(TraitPredicate()), /home/rafael/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/core/src/iter/traits/collect.rs:202:1: 202:23 (#0))] }', /rustc/07e0e2ec268c140e607e1ac7f49f145612d0f597/compiler/rustc_query_system/src/query/plumbing.rs:593:5 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.53.0-nightly (07e0e2ec2 2021-03-24) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [predicates_of] computing predicates of `std::iter::IntoIterator` #1 [typeck] type-checking `counting_duplicates` end of query stack error: could not compile `counting_duplicates` To learn more, run the command again with --verbose. ```
Backtrace

```bash $ RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo test Compiling counting_duplicates v0.1.0 (/home/rafael/Documents/Repos/CodeArchive/CodeWars/counting_duplicates) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'found unstable fingerprints for predicates_of(core[3998]::iter::traits::collect::IntoIterator): GenericPredicates { parent: None, predicates: [(Binder(TraitPredicate()), /home/rafael/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/core/src/iter/traits/collect.rs:202:1: 202:23 (#0))] }', /rustc/07e0e2ec268c140e607e1ac7f49f145612d0f597/compiler/rustc_query_system/src/query/plumbing.rs:593:5 stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/07e0e2ec268c140e607e1ac7f49f145612d0f597/library/std/src/panicking.rs:493:5 1: std::panicking::begin_panic_fmt at /rustc/07e0e2ec268c140e607e1ac7f49f145612d0f597/library/std/src/panicking.rs:435:5 2: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::incremental_verify_ich 3: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::load_from_disk_and_cache_in_memory 4: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 5: ::predicates_of 6: rustc_middle::ty::generics::GenericPredicates::instantiate_into 7: rustc_middle::ty::generics::GenericPredicates::instantiate 8: rustc_typeck::check::fn_ctxt::_impl::::instantiate_bounds 9: rustc_typeck::check::fn_ctxt::_impl::::add_required_obligations 10: rustc_typeck::check::fn_ctxt::_impl::::resolve_lang_item_path 11: rustc_typeck::check::expr::::check_expr_kind 12: rustc_typeck::check::expr::::check_expr_with_expectation 13: rustc_typeck::check::callee::::check_call 14: rustc_typeck::check::expr::::check_expr_kind 15: rustc_typeck::check::expr::::check_expr_with_expectation 16: rustc_typeck::check::_match::::demand_scrutinee_type 17: rustc_typeck::check::_match::::check_match 18: rustc_typeck::check::expr::::check_expr_kind 19: rustc_typeck::check::expr::::check_expr_with_expectation 20: rustc_typeck::check::expr::::check_expr_with_expectation 21: rustc_typeck::check::fn_ctxt::checks::::check_stmt 22: rustc_typeck::check::fn_ctxt::checks::::check_block_with_expected 23: rustc_typeck::check::expr::::check_expr_with_expectation 24: rustc_typeck::check::expr::::check_return_expr 25: rustc_typeck::check::check::check_fn 26: rustc_infer::infer::InferCtxtBuilder::enter 27: rustc_typeck::check::typeck 28: rustc_middle::dep_graph::::with_deps 29: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl 30: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::force_query_with_job 31: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 32: ::typeck 33: rustc_middle::ty::::par_body_owners 34: rustc_typeck::check::typeck_item_bodies 35: rustc_middle::dep_graph::::with_deps 36: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl 37: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 38: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::force_query_with_job 39: rustc_middle::dep_graph::::with_deps 45: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl 46: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 47: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::force_query_with_job 48: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 49: ::analysis 50: rustc_interface::passes::QueryContext::enter 51: rustc_interface::queries::::enter 52: rustc_span::with_source_map 53: rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run 54: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.53.0-nightly (07e0e2ec2 2021-03-24) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [predicates_of] computing predicates of `std::iter::IntoIterator` #1 [typeck] type-checking `counting_duplicates` #2 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies #3 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: could not compile `counting_duplicates` To learn more, run the command again with --verbose. ```
